summary: An ordinance repealing Ordinance No. 6912 entitled: "An ordinance relating to and providing for the improvement of Vine Street, in the City of Seattle, from Railroad Avenue to 1st Avenue, by recurbing, and replanking the same, including the reconstruction of a bridge at the west end of said street, and providing the payment therefor by the mode of 'Payment by Bond' as provided by an act of the Legislature of the State of Washington entitled "An act authorizing the issuance and sale of bonds by cities, to pay for local improvements, providing for the payment thereof, and declaring an emergency", approved March 14, 1899, and Ordinance No. 5693 of said city, approved December 6, 1899."
